Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk dhclient
exit 0

isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk dhcp
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: dhcp bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) is a protocol that allows individual devices on an IP network to get their own network configuration information, including an IP address, a subnet mask, and a broadcast address. The dhcp packages provide a relay agent and ISC DHCP service required to enable and administer DHCP on a network. This update fixes the following bugs: Prior to this update, if a plain interface and a VLAN trunk were configured in the "dhcpd" server at the same time, requests with VLAN tags incorrectly generated "DHCPOFFER" responses on the plain interface as well as the VLAN. The "dhcpd" server has been fixed and now correctly ignores packets with VLAN tags on plain interfaces. (BZ#1175350) Previously, when using the "dhclient" DHCP protocol client on a host with two network interfaces connected to the same subnet, "DHCPREQUEST" packets were only being sent to one of the interfaces. Consequently, the IP address lease of the other interface was not being renewed. With this update, "dhclient" sends "DHCPREQUEST" and "DHCPRELEASE" packets to both interfaces, even if they are on the same subnetwork. (BZ#1177351) Booting a large number of nodes with InfiniBand network interface controllers at the same time could previously result in the same IP address assigned to multiple nodes. This was caused by the Transaction ID (XID) field being generated incorrectly. This update provides a fix to the XID field generation process, and all nodes now correctly receive unique IP addresses. (BZ#1195693) Previously, if the "dhclient" DHCP client was configured to perform Dynamic DNS (DDNS) updates, renewing an IP address lease caused it to crash. With this update, the bug has been fixed and "dhclient" can renew an IP address lease successfuly without crashing. (BZ#1187856) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: Supports for DHCP option 97 - Client Machine Identifier ("pxe-client-id") has been added to "dhcpd". This option allows you to reserve (statically allocate) IP addresses for a particular client, based on its identifier sent in option 97. This can be used as an alternative to DHCP option 61 ("dhcp-client-identifier"). (BZ#1175422) Users of dhcp are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
